segments.text: I see the water pouring over the sink, and it’s making me feel a little sick.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is spreading, and the woman doesn’t even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets are getting soaked, and it’s just gross.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost smell the dampness from here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being sneaky, but the water is the real problem.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like this kitchen is turning into a swamp.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it’s been like this—it’s getting worse by the second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just unpleasant to look at.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone cleans this up soon.
segments.speaker: PAR
